events.name: Upcycled T-shirt Bags Workshop
events.description:
Come join us this World Environment Day (5 June) for an exclusive bag-making workshop with Doreen Eng, Co-founder of Wondrous Light and Wondrous Light Children's House! Learn to craft practical bags from old tee-shirts in this workshop. Suitable for all adults and children aged 10 and above. 
Bring along your sewing kits and any other recycled items you’d like to decorate your bag with. Clean, recyclable tee-shirts will be provided. 
Join us in saving the environment and sign up now! 


About Doreen Eng

Doreen discovered her passion in creative art and handcrafts in 2007, and has since been developing her skills as an artist through mediums such as acrylic art, encaustic art, handmade crafts, and even in writing children's stories and songs. She co-founded Wondrous Light - a communal space for craft-making and creative projects, as well as Wondrous Light Children's House - a children's santuary to inspire and cultivate creatvity through self-directed play and various crafting and artistic activities. 
Enquiries
Do contact Haris Thong @ 96478441 or haristhong@informatics.edu.sg if you have any questions about the event.
Poster elements designed by Pixel Buddha & Roundicons from flaticon.com
Photo: Feline Lim, Venessa Lee, Ng Sor Luan, Preschool Resources from The Straits Times
events.location: National Library Building, 100 Victoria Street, #13-01/02, Singapore 188064

events.name: Singapore Microsoft Flow Meetup - Let's build a flow. No coding skills required.
events.description: Let's kick off our Singapore Microsoft Flow (https://flow.microsoft.com) users meetup by learning the basics of Microsoft Flow. Once we are comfortable with the basics, we will create a flow that uses some of the popular services such as Dropbox, Twitter, SharePoint, Microsoft Office 365 and Facebook. The meetup will be interactive, and it will be presented by Deon Herbert, a Microsoft employee who works on the Microsoft Flow team in Redmond, Washington, USA.
events.location: Microsoft Corporation Singapore ,  One Marina Boulevard, Level 22,Singapore 018989
events.group_name: Learn about Microsoft Flow from an insider

events.name: Knot-Tying Workshop (Free)
events.description:
The Parkinson Society Singapore is collaborating with Project Novo, a group of Hwa Chong Institution students in this series of workshops for People with Parkinson. Participants will learn how to tie various decorative knots and paracord bracelets proficiently. Tying decorative knots and paracord bracelets helps improve motor skills and as it requires precise movement of the fingers, which is good training to help People with Parkinson improve their dexterity. The complexity of knot-tying also helps to keep their minds active.Through these 2-part workshops, participants will experience the varieties of knot tying and will be able to bring home the various knots and bracelets that they tie during the class. Each of the two parts has its own independent activity, so you can choose to attend any one of the two dates for each part, or all of them if you would like to practice with the supervision of our experts!Course details:2-Part Workshop in 4 Sessions | 5, 7, 12 & 13 June | 2 PM – 4 PM (2 hour per session)Part 1: Introducing Paracord Bracelets and Their Designs | 5 June OR 7 June 2017 | 2 PM – 4 PM (2 hours)
Part 2: Introducing Decorative Knots and How to Make Paracord Jewellery | 12 OR 13 June 2017 | 2 PM – 4 PM (2 hours)
Venue: Parkinson Society SingaporeBlk 191 Bishan St 13 #01-415, Singapore 570191Course Fee: Free of Charge*Materials will be provided. Participant may bring home completed product(s).
#MovetoBeatParkinson #ParkinsonsDisease #Paracord #Knots
For more details, please call The Parkinson Centre at 6353 5338 or email info@parkinson.org.sg
events.location: Parkinson Society Singapore, 191 Bishan Street 13, #01-415, Singapore 570191

events.name: Social Coding
events.description: A space for women coders to learn from each other, to practice and discuss learnings with fellow peers. This would be a weekly event of informal space to do coding. So bring your pet projects along or join one of our existing teams/ projects to work on. Featured Projects:https://trello.com/b/kl2BTwil/wwc-sg-social-coding-projects First timers, please read:Newbies Step-by-step Guide Please bring your own laptop. Agenda:6:30p - Registration and Introduce projects7:00p - Break out into groups and Start coding! ^_^8:30p - End session There is no food provided, so please make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, we recommend to bring your own water bottle along. Psst, this event is intended for ladies only. Host:
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre

events.name: Michael Wuehler presents infrastructure on INFURA + MetaMask
events.description:
Hello fellow Etherians, Michael Wuehler, a founder of the Ethereum NYC (https://www.meetup.com/NYC_Ethereum/), founder of INFURA, will be in town this coming June for a session of masterclass on the Ethereum Development infrastructure around INFURA (https://infura.io/) and MetaMask (https://metamask.io/). Come hear more about developing on Ethereum and how you can leverage on products like INFURA, MetaMask to enhance your development environment from the very best! This event's logistics are fully sponsored by the ConsenSys team and we very much appreciate their support for the event!   Event Timeline:  6:30 - 7:00 pm : Registration + Reception 7:00 - 8:00 pm : Michael's Keynote 8:00 - 8:15 pm: QnA + Reception 


Organizers:   


Venue Sponsor:  Have your questions in the comment box and I'll have them posted to Michael prior to the event! See you there,  Ethereum Singapore Organizers

events.name: Papers We Love #027
events.description:
Paper #1: Generating Compiler Optimizations from Proofs - Ross Tate, MichaelStepp, Sorin Lerner https://www.cs.cornell.edu/~ross/publications/proofgen/proofgen_tate_popl10_tr.pdf - Benjamin Lim

Paper #2: AEG: Automatic Exploit Generation - Thanassis Avgerinos, et al. http://security.ece.cmu.edu/aeg/aeg-current.pdf - Wong Wai Tuck

-------------------

What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved?

What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? 

Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. 

Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss.

-----------------

Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love
Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love
Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
events.location: HackerspaceSG, 344B King George's Avenue, King George's Building, Singapore 208576
